content: in my quest for easier and quicker stone
texture I came upon this roller and I thought oh this would be great the only
problem is the nubs are uniform and I didn't want you know a uniform kind of
pattern on the stone on the stone work right I wanted to be random so what I
decided to do was just nip some of these off with the scissors and I figured that
would make it more random I also had the idea of using the glue
gun to kind of smooth it out a bit so they're not so extreme and I figured
that would be really nice when I rolled over the styro with it so let's take a
look at this rolling it over with the roller if you can roll different
directions and you'll lose any kind of pattern in there really great but it
gives a really nice stone texture just super easy I love this great this is
gonna be so handy to have now you know with the step with a styro I've just got
the foam core here to reinforce the styro and make it take the paint better
you can use some Mod Podge matte Mod Podge with some black paint in it or use
some Elmer's glue-all can just paint it up you know paint it gray and then add a
few other colors or Browns and tans and that kind of thing you don't want the
stone that just looked straight gray the next step is to highlight the foam with
a damp sponge and dip it in a light grey and kind of dapple it on the surface it
gives a nice highlight add a nice wash to it I kind of dimpled off the wash a
little bit in areas and here it is all dry so just a great stone look you can
really see the texture on there from the roller so I hope you guys enjoyed this
craft and I'll see you next time
you
